website_summaries.verdict: The Sony XBA-NC85D is marginally effective at canceling noise and its disappointing sound quality does nothing to offset the exorbitant price.
pros: The Sony XBA-NC85D noise-canceling in-ear headphones feature batteries conveniently built in to the earpieces that recharge with the included USB stick
cons: The build quality doesn't justify its ambitious price, and they fall short in sound quality and noise-canceling performance
Your music also dies when the battery runs out, and the tangle-prone wire lacks inline controls as well as a microphone

customer_reviews.title: Return the item and buy another that coul be working for me. The design of this ear headphones were designed for big ears only.
customer_reviews.text: This item does not work. My ears are small and the armature is heavy. The headphones do not stay on my ears. The armature is big also and are hot working for me. I wasted my money. I want to retun them. I have used 3 times only. They were designed for big and strong ears, not for women. I want to retun them. Thanks and have a nice day.
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed by the bass sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed by the bass sound quality. It was flat and unresponsive. The mids and highs were very clear but the total lack of anywhere near quality bass sound caused me to send them back. I even compared them to a non brand headphone with wood pieces in the headphone and there was no comparison, the non brand headphones outclassed them Sony's. I found that very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: SV

customer_reviews.title: Require Charging on a computer--not able to charge with an outlet
customer_reviews.text: These head set had to be charged on the computer--not an outlet on the wall. After unsuccessfully trying to charge the headset on three different computersI, I decided to return them. I never got to even hear how they sound. I expected to be able to use them with no charging. Another tough lesson I learned is that I did not read the return policy. Hopefully you will.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Scott

customer_reviews.title: stay away from this at all costs - even free!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound and noise blocking but: 2 hour battery life after 2 months of use. useless without charge useless when charging charing only with propriertary usb to mini din plug This product never went through usability QA testing. It is a disaster!
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very good noise-cancelling headphone, it has very good function in cancelling the noise ! I like it very much. Good.
customer_reviews.author: CHENGJIANHUA

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pair of iems!
customer_reviews.text: Would love to hear an updated version for this. The look is pretty the best of all in ear noise cancelling. There is some hissing noted when NC is activated but it ain't that big of a deal when you listen to dance / trance cause the beats will drown it away.
customer_reviews.author: 4EVERME

customer_reviews.title: NC is weak
customer_reviews.text: I had given only 3 stars due to NC is weak and there is cord noise rubbing the body. I have other NC earphone from audio-technical & bose. This you can hear the music without the noise on train, bus and plane. Otherwise the sound quality is very good. But the bass is not heavy like those beats headphone. Not suitable for those that like heavy bass.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur C

customer_reviews.title: Sound ok! but poor N,C. !
customer_reviews.text: Very poor noise canceling . A $40 Sony #NC11, actually does abetter job, and is more comfortable in the ear. Sony missed badly on these. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: RJGUY

customer_reviews.title: Unahppy with Sony XBA-NC85D
customer_reviews.text: I was very unhappy. I returned it because it did not noise cancel but I also found it difficult to use. Amazon was great about taking it back with no hassle. I cannot recommend it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Feinberg, M.D.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The NC function doesn't work, at all! Simple as that.
customer_reviews.author: Lc96157

customer_reviews.title: I guess one man's tin can
customer_reviews.text: . . . is another man's cork-lined room. I have an expensive pair of Bose noise-cancelling ear buds and although the sound quality is superb there is still plenty of ambient sound that leaks through. These, on the other hand, might even tempt Proust out of the house--the ambient sound elimination is like being in an isolation box. Indeed, it's almost spooky how well these work. As for the sound quality, I'm a big Bruckner fan and his symphonies (especially the Seventh) sounded particularly rich to me. I'm not into heavy bass-driven music, so it is possible that Eminem might come across a bit tinny but then again I'll never know.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Odaniel

customer_reviews.title: You`re better off burning your cash in a firepit.
customer_reviews.text: I`ve never felt so ripped off buying anything in my life. If they had been $50 I still would have felt like I wasted money. Sony has always been a go to for good gear but this will have me second guessing anything I ever consider purchasing from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Jones

customer_reviews.title: Portable and STRONG
customer_reviews.text: These earphones are a great alternative to over-the-ear noise canceling headphones, like those from Bose or Sony. They are portable and work great - and give great sound. I have not yet tried charging them, but out-of-the-box they were simple to hook up with my iPhone and go to town. Great sound, cancels a great deal of ambient noise, and they come with a cute carrying case. Yahoo!
customer_reviews.author: Lois Lain

customer_reviews.title: NC 85D deception
customer_reviews.text: I have to try to use this headphones since 6 months that I bought, with several PMP ( ipod,sony walkman, cowon and samsung galaxy player) for to have all arguments and give a chance, but the result ALWAYS was the same: 1- the sound is terrible ( the worst bass ever and poorly clear) 2- noise cancelling function is a joke 3- Price ( that hurts!) is needlessly high for the function: Never again i ̈ll buy a sony headphones, in the market exist very much better option in a 1/5 of the price of this piece of trash. My patiente has been broken
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo A. Gil Florez

customer_reviews.title: They have to be charged
customer_reviews.text: These do block extraneous background noise and do provide nice sound. However, they must be recharged periodically. The charger is included, as is a pouch. Good as they are, the cost is prohibitive if one has any chance of losing them or getting them damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann

product_meta.title: Sony XBANC85D Balanced Armature Digital Noise-Cancelling In-Ear Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: Sony XBA-NC85D In-Ear Headphones require a charged battery for use. Headphones are charged with the included USB adapter.
feature_bullets: Precision canceling reduces up to 97.5% ambient noise
Flexible USB charging via PC or USB AC charging adapter

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.7 out of 5 stars27 ratings2.7 out of 5 stars
